course.subject: MECH
course.name: Robot Manipulation
course.description: Extensive introduction to robot manipulation theory from a geometric viewpoint. Rigid-body kinematics; spatial and body representation of rigid-body velocities; coordinate transformations; forward kinematics of open-chain manipulators; solution of inverse kinematics; robot workspaces; nonlinear decoupling control and force control.

reviews.author: Ben Lee
reviews.comment_content: I do not come from the robotic background so a lot of work is required to undetstand what is going on lol. Reading the reference book definitely helps. You can refer to another feedback which gave comprehensive sllybus of what is going to be taught.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor will do recordings of sesions as well as real life session and we will go through the material in a form of lectures. I think that is a good practice. The recordings are clear in terms of voice and video capture.
reviews.comment_grading: I got B+. I am alright with that.
reviews.comment_workload: There is 1 mid term assignment, 1 mid term presentation and a final term paper.

reviews.author: ryannn
reviews.title: A worth-taking course for Robotics
reviews.comment_content:
The course teach you through robotics basics to advanced algorithms. Most of the lessson, of course, doing math. But no worry, professor explain in every bit of details. A lot of examples are also provided and covered in the lecture,

If you have taken robotics course in your bachelor degree, this course help you refresh and crushed into more advanced topics. Syllabus listed below: for your reference:

Week 1: Configuration space
Week 2: Rigid-body motions
Week 4: Robot kinematics
Week 5: Robot motion planning: foundations
Week 6: Sampling-based motion planning
Week 7: Other motion planning algorithms
Week 8: Rigid-body dynamics
Week 9: Robot dynamics I
Week 11: Robot dynamics II  
Week 12: Robot control: foundations
Week 13: Motion control
Week 14: Force/hybrid/impedance control
reviews.comment_teaching: The instructor explained and expressed very neatly about all the equations written on the whiteboard. Very nice and you can ask for any doubts anytime.
reviews.comment_grading: The grades is evaluated through the final course project. Presentation with feedback is expected. Term paper and proposal shall be well written. For grades, I receive a B+. The grade is lower than expected, but actually I spend little time on it.
reviews.comment_workload: Light Workload. A project presentation (and proposal written) and also a submission of final paper is required. An extra coding assignment is released as a bonus mark to your grade.
